item.title: Super Pocket Rare Edition Brings 14 Titles Including Banjo-Kazooie
item.content:encoded:
Play classic Rare games, including Banjo-Kazooie, Evercade cartridges, and more on the brand new Super Pocket Rare Edition. The handheld, which is made by HyperMegaTech, is slated for release in June 2026. An exact date has not been specified.

The handheld, which is made by HyperMegaTech, is slated for release in June 2026. An exact date has not been specified.

The item will be priced at $69 in the United States of America. It will also cost ¬£49 in the United Kingdom and ‚Ç¨59 throughout other parts of Europe. Pre-orders are available now.

What Games Will Be Playable on Super Pocket Rare Edition? Built-In Titles Explained

In addition to the ability to play Evercade cartridges, the handheld will have 14 Rare-developed classic titles built in. The 14 games span a wide range of the company‚Äôs history, including their days making games for the ZX Spectrum.

Popular titles like Battletoads are also included, as is Conker‚Äôs Pocket Tails, the Game Boy Color predecessor to Conker‚Äôs Bad Fur Day on the Nintendo 64

Check out the full list of games below:

  • Atic Atac
  • Banjo-Kazooie
  • Battletoads in Battlemaniacs
  • Battletoads
  • Cobra Triangle
  • Conker‚Äôs Pocket Tails
  • Gunfright
  • Jetpac
  • Knight Lore
  • Lunar Jetman
  • R.C. Pro-Am II
  • Slalom
  • Snake Rattle‚ÄôN‚ÄôRoll
  • Solar Jetman

Are you excited for this forthcoming handle? Will you be pre-ordering? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Battlefield 6 1.2.1.5 Update Improves Stability and Gameplay
item.content:encoded:
Updates have been announced for Battlefield 6 in version 1.2.1.5

The Battlefield Communications team announced the next update to the game. This next update focuses on quality-of-life improvements, stability fixes, and the resolution of issues across a wide variety of game modes and overall gameplay.

Touted Quality-of-Life Updates Coming to Battlefield 6

The new update is scheduled to go live on March 3. Among the major updates are additional stability improvements to prevent crashes. Also, the team says they have improved the front-end for a smoother experience.

Plus, they say they‚Äôve restored missing Store items to player inventory. These items are from the Bountiful Harvest, Pax Vanguard, and Devil Dogs bundles.

Additional Improvements Coming in New Update

Other updates to Battlefield 6 that players may be interested in include updated spawn logic with an additional out-of-combat area check to prevent unintended spawn locations. Also, they have addressed the issue that saw Battle Pass rewards on the active path could display placeholder text or missing icons.

On the REDSEC front, they‚Äôve tackled the issue in Battle Royale Duos where pings weren‚Äôt displayed in the elimination feed. Also, they fixed the issue where the Tracking Pulse Recon trait could activate when destroying any deployable gadget.

Other issues related to Portal stability, audio, and more were addressed. Players can check out the full statement here.

Do these improvements make you want to play more Battlefield 6? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Can You Access Outpost Zone In Marathon Server Slam Playtest?
item.content:encoded:
The Marathon Server Slam Playtest is finally here, and it gives players a huge glimpse into what the full game will be like at launch. From early quests to the full roster of guns, there‚Äôs plenty for fans to dip their feet into, but there does seem to be one major point of confusion.

The maps. When you load up the Marathon Server Slam Playtest and prepare for a run, you‚Äôll see three maps available: Perimeter, Dire Marsh, and Outpost. There‚Äôs no trouble accessing the first two, but Outpost seems to be causing some problems.

If you‚Äôre confused, then don‚Äôt worry, you‚Äôre in the right place. Here‚Äôs whether you can access the Outpost map during the Marathon Server Slam Playtest.

Can You Access The Outpost Zone In The Marathon Server Slam Playtest?

Unfortunately, despite it appearing on the map selection screen, you cannot play on the Outpost map during the Marathon Server Slam Playtest.

It might come as a disappointment to some fans out there, especially since it‚Äôs teased for all to see, but Bungie did warn players which maps will be playable during the Playtest‚Äîand Outpost didn‚Äôt make the cut.

  • More Insider Gaming: Every Runner Shell In Marathon

Still, it does pose a new question for fans of the Server Slam: When will Outpost be playable?

When Will Outpost Be Playable In Marathon?

The Outpost map will be fully playable when Marathon releases on March 5, 2026. It will be one of the three maps available at launch, alongside both Perimeter and Dire Marsh.

With that in mind, it‚Äôs honestly quite crazy that Bungie made two of the three maps playable during what is essentially a glorified beta test for the game. That doesn‚Äôt leave a whole lot left to uncover when the game officially releases, but there is still the largely unknown endgame map‚Äîthe Cryo Archive.

  • More Insider Gaming: Factions In Marathon, Explained

Bungie have described this as the ultimate endgame for Marathon, and it should be playable just a few weeks after launch. Fingers crossed that it‚Äôs worth the wait, and that Outpost is just as fun to explore as the other two maps.

How are you finding the Marathon Server Slam Playtest? Share your thoughts and chat to fellow Runners in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more Marathon content, check out the matchmaking options, as well as how to claim the Twitch Drops.

item.title: Pok√©mon 30th Anniversary TCG Set Release Date Period Details & What To Expect
item.content:encoded:
If you can‚Äôt get enough of the real-life Pok√©mon Trading Card Game, then you need to get ready for a Pok√©mon 30th Anniversary TCG Set, and early release period details are out for it.

Collectors everywhere don‚Äôt care how many new Pok√©mon sets are released in the TCG; packs will be bought, cards will be pulled, and binders will be stacked. We learned so much from the Pok√©mon Presents February 2026 showcase, and one of the biggest surprises was the announcement of a 30th anniversary set.

When Is Pok√©mon‚Äôs 30th Anniversary TCG Set Coming Out? Release Period, Explained

The Pok√©mon Company has indicated that the set is arriving at some point in 2026, but based on historical data, it‚Äôs believed the set is destined for a Fall 2026 release‚Äîbetween September and November.

Everyone hates vague release windows, especially ones that span a full year!

  • More Insider Gaming: 7 Things Learned From Pok√©mon Winds & Waves Trailer

But a closer look at dedicated Pok√©mon TCG social media pages might give more useful insight into when it‚Äôs arriving. Pokemon TCG Restocks & News said: ‚ÄúIf it follows the past Celebrations set, it will likely release in the fall!‚Äù

Furthermore, Pok√©mon Deals, Stock & News UK offered a similar sentiment:

‚ÄúThey just said 2026. I expect around September/October.‚Äù

Obviously, this doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs guaranteed, but with Perfect Order and Chaos Rising arriving next, we know the 30th Anniversary set isn‚Äôt releasing anytime soon. A Fall 2026 window looks very likely, so it would be wise to assume it‚Äôs another few months off yet.

What To Expect From Pok√©mon 30th Anniversary TCG Set

The Pok√©mon 30th Anniversary TCG Set is expected to be a reprint of many of the TCG‚Äôs most iconic cards over the last three decades, immortalized with a special 30th anniversary logo or stamp.

  • More Insider Gaming: All Pok√©mon Winds & Waves Starters

Here‚Äôs every card shown in the set reveal trailer to give you an idea of what‚Äôs coming:

  • Charizard (Base Set)
  • Lugia (e-Series Crystal)
  • Palkia Lv. X
  • Uxie (Diamond & Pearl)
  • Giratina & Darkrai (Legends)
  • Genesect EX
  • Solgaleo GX
  • Zacian V
  • Pikachu & Zekrom GX (Tag Team)
  • Raikou (Amazing Rare)
  • Arceus VStar

This is merely a taster of what‚Äôs likely to be a full 200-300 card set, littered with Holos, Full Arts, and many more insanely valuable rares‚Äîthere‚Äôs got to be some Charizards, right?

Will you be hoarding packs and Trainer Boxes for the 30th Anniversary set? Which cards are you hoping are included? Share your predictions and thoughts on the set via the Insider Gaming Discord!

For more fun Pok√©mon content, check out how to get the Pok√©mon Game Music Collection, as well as how to get Running Shoes in Pok√©mon Fire Red & Leaf Green.
